fields.contents:
In the event that two or more individuals (or lounges) are tied for the most points, then the timestamp associated with the final goal, commitment, or activity associated with the individuals (or lounges) will be used to break the tie. In other words, the individual (or lounges) who got to their final point total first will be declared the winner. In the remote event that the final timestamps are equal, a coin toss will be used to decide the winner.

Given that energy consumption is measured down to the watt-hour, we do not anticipate that any floor could tie with respect to their consumption. In case that this does occur, a coin toss will be used to decide the winner.
fields.title: In the Event of Ties

fields.contents:
In the energy goal game on the [Go Low page](/energy), there is obviously an energy goal that has been set for your lounge. The numeric value of the goal (in kilowatt-hours) was set by measuring the baseline energy use in your lounge in the period before the Kukui Cup started, and then reducing it by a certain percentage.

Since the energy goal is based on the usage of your particular lounge, it is intended to be a reachable goal. And every day your lounge meets the goal, everyone playing in your lounge gets 20 points!
fields.title: How is the energy goal picked?

fields.contents: Some of the activities in the Smart Grid Game involve commitments, and you can engage in up to five commitments at any one time. We notice that you are committed to just "N" commitments. Why not go for all five and earn the super-committed badge for energy conservation? To make a commitment, go to the Get Nutz page and find <5 - N> more commitments that you are comfortable carrying out. Remember that a commitment only lasts for five days and then have to renew it if you want to continue the commitment. You get points for each commitment you complete for a five day period.
fields.title: Making Commitments

fields.contents: One of the most challenging games in the Kukui Cup is the Daily Energy Goal. We have collected data on your lounge's energy usage since the beginning of the semester, and for this quest, you need to work with your lounge mates to reduce your lounge's overall usage by 5%. Each day that your lounge meets or beats this conservation goal, you and everyone else in your lounge will earn Kukui Cup points. To set a conservation goal, start by going to the Go Low page by clicking on the energy meter icon at the top of this page. Once there, find out your lounge's current consumption for today and see if it's above or below the goal. Then do whatever you can personally to minimize your energy consumption for the remainder of today, and encourage your lounge mates to do the same. See the Go Low page for suggestions on what to do. If you're successful, your lounge will have used less energy than the goal by midnight tonight, and everyone in your lounge will get awarded Kukui Cup points!
fields.title: Setting Conservation Goals

fields.title: Award Categories and Prizes

fields.contents:
Motivation

One of the goals of the Kukui Cup is to learn more about the factors which help people to make sustained, positive changes to their energy behaviors.

Kinds of data collected

In order to accomplish this goal, we wish to collect and analyze data about your participation in the competition. This data takes three forms:
  1. Data collected from your interactions with this website. We will collect data about the things you do while logged in to this website, such as your activities, goals, and commitments. This helps us to understand which of these tasks are interesting and helpful.
  2. Data gathered through interviews and questionnaires. We will contact a subset of participants to request a short interview and/or to fill out an online questionnaire. This data will help us to understand more about the strengths and weaknesses of our approach.
  3. Data gathered about the electricity use of your lounge (A-E, pairs of floors) in aggregate. This aggregate data on electricity does not provide us with any information on the electricity usage of individual rooms.

Privacy

No identifying information about you will be made available in any research publications resulting from this study.

Note that as part of your participation in the competition, information such as your "public commitments" will be made available to others via mechanisms such as the Kukui Cup "wall" in your home page. The website may offer you the opportunity to share your competition activities on Facebook. If you actively choose to share data with Facebook, then public commitments and activities will be transmitted to Facebook. However, we record no data from Facebook (such as your friend list).

If you do not wish to participate

Your participation in this study is voluntary. If you decide you do not wish to participate in this study at any time, please contact Philip Johnson (johnson@hawaii.edu, 956-3489, POST 307, University of Hawaii). We will remove your data from all analyses.

You can decline to participate in this study but still participate in the Kukui Cup. Your decision to participate or not has no impact on your ability to win prizes or participate in events associated with the competition. Simply continue to participate in the competition, and contact Prof. Johnson to have your information removed from the study data.
fields.title: Terms and Conditions

fields.contents:
In an individual competition, you compete to accumulate the most points by performing various actions, including activities, events, and commitments. To win in the individual competition, you simply have to accumulate the most points. 

Lounges are also ranked by how many points their residents earned, and there are prizes for lounges too.
fields.title: Point competitions

fields.contents:
This panel shows what you have accomplished in the Kukui Cup so far. The top portion of the window shows things that are pending, such as current commitments and activities that are waiting for verification from the administrators. The bottom portion shows activities that are completed, along with how many points you earned for each one.

You can go to the activity page by clicking on the name of the activity.
fields.title: My Achievements

fields.contents:
The Kukui Cup supports a variety of competitions:
  • The "literacy" competition encourages you to learn about energy, water, and other resource usage through the smart grid game and other activities, all which earn you points.
  • The "energy" competition tracks your energy usage through meters installed in your team's residence.
  • The "water" competition tracks your water usage through meters installed in your team's residence.
Not all Kukui Cup challenges support all competitions.
fields.title: Competitions

fields.contents: In the lounge energy competition, pairs of floors in each Hale Aloha tower compete as a unit. Each tower is divided into five lounges consisting of floors 3-4 (lounge A), 5-6 (lounge B), 7-8 (lounge C), 9-10 (lounge D), and 11-12 (lounge E). To win in the lounge energy competition, your lounge must use the least energy across all the lounges in the 4 Hale Aloha towers.
fields.title: Lounge Energy Competition

fields.contents:
The competition lasts three weeks, starting Monday October 17 at 12:01 AM, and ending at midnight on Sunday November 6.

To provide multiple chances to win, the competition is divided into three week-long "rounds": Round 1, Round 2, as well as an overall "grand prize" round in week 3.

After the first week of competition, the winners of Round 1 will be announced based upon those individuals who accumulated the most points and those lounges who used the least amount of energy.

After the second week of competition, the winners of Round 2 will be announced. Round 2 winners are based only on points and energy use from the second week of the competition.

After the third week of competition, the "Grand Prize" winners will be announced. The Grand Prize winners are based upon all the overall points and energy use from all 3 weeks. 

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/calendar/embed?height=600&wkst=1&bgcolor=%23FFFFFF&src=hp27n91330a92lkesc6bhoqgqo%40group.calendar.google.com&color=%23182C57&ctz=Pacific%2FHonolulu&dates=20111001%2F20111031" style=" border-width:0 " width="800" height="600" frameborder="0" scrolling="no"></iframe>
fields.title: Timeline

fields.contents: Some of the activites in the Smart Grid Game involve you to watch a video, attend an event, or do certain activities around the dorms. To do an activity, go to the Get Nutz page and find an activity that you would like to perform. After performing an activity, there will be either questions, code inputs, or image uploads that you will have to provide to prove that you have done the activity. After an Admin approves the activity you done, you will get your points!
fields.title: Performing Activities

fields.contents: A plug load is the energy consumed by any electronic device that's plugged into a socket. So most of the energy use in your room comes from plug loads, plus the ceiling light.
fields.title: What is plug load?

fields.contents: Yes you can! Some events and activities have social bonus points that will be added to your accumulated ponts if attend the event or activity with someone else from Hale Aloha.
fields.title: Can I collaborate with people on other lounges?

fields.contents: You could use the "Ask an Admin" on the [Help page](/help/). This will send in your question to an Admin who will reply to you with an available answer. Also, at the top of every page is a "Send Feedback" button that you can use to ask a question from anywhere on the website.
fields.title: How do I contact you with questions?

fields.contents:
The Raffle Game provides a different way to win prizes, a way that does not require you to be the number 1 ranked lounge or person. Each time you accumulate 25 Kukui Cup points, you receive 1 raffle ticket, which you can allocate into a drawing for one or more of the prizes in the raffle. Your chances of winning that prize correspond to the percentage of tickets allocated to that prize that you contributed. You can change your ticket allocation at any time during a round. The more points you earn, the more tickets you receive, and the higher your chances of winning prizes in the raffle.

Your raffle tickets don't expire at the end of Round 1 or Round 2, so you can save them up if you want. But they do expire at the end of the Kukui Cup, so don't wait too long!
fields.title: How does the raffle work?

fields.contents: You will see the detailed information of the activity in this widget.  <p/> You will be asked to either complete the activity or sign up for an event. after event or commitment period, you can come back here to claim the rest of your points.
fields.title: Task Details Widget Help

fields.contents: Welcome to the Smart Grid Game! Each square contains an activity you can complete to earn points. Grid squares containing numbers are activities that you have not yet completed, and the number shows how many points the activity is worth. Grid squares with the lock icon ![lock icon](/site_media/staticimages/lock24.png) are locked, but you can click on the lock icon to see how to unlock it. Usually, you need to complete some other activities in order to unlock an activity. Once an activity is completed, a checkmark will appear in the upper left corner of the square. If any activity needs your attention, an exclamation point will appear in the upper left corner of its square. You might need to correct your answer to a question, the time period for a commitment might be completed, or an event or excursion you signed up for has finished so you can come back to claim the rest of your points.
fields.title: Smart Grid Game

fields.contents:
The Daily Energy Goal Game is a way to keep your lounge on track to win the energy competition. This panel shows how much energy your lounge has used so far today, compared to an energy reduction goal set by the Kukui Cup administrators. If the traffic light is:

* <FONT COLOR="ff0000">Red</FONT>, it means your lounge is currently exceeding the energy consumption goal.
* <FONT COLOR="FCD116">Yellow</FONT>, it means your lounge is close to using more energy than your goal
* <FONT COLOR="00ff00">Green</FONT>, your lounge is doing a great job so keep it up!

If your lounge is able to keep the energy usage under the goal for the entire day, everyone in your lounge will earn 20 points.
fields.title: Energy Goal Game

fields.contents:
This panel shows how much power your lounge is using right now in watts. It updates every 15 seconds.

You can use this power gauge to run an experiment: try turning something on or off and check if you can see the difference in your lounge's power use.
fields.title: Lounge Power

fields.contents:
A screenshot is a picture of what is currently displayed on the screen. To take a screenshot on a Macintosh:

1. Make sure your screen is showing what you want to capture
2. Hold down the following three keys at the same time Command (⌘), Shift, and the number 3 (Command-Shift-3)
3. A file will be created on the desktop titled "Screen shot" followed by the current date and time.
4. You can now upload that screen shot file to the Kukui Cup.
fields.title: How do I take a screenshot on a Mac?

fields.contents:
This panel describes an activity that you can perform to earn points. Some activities involve watching a video, others will require you to go off and do something.

When you complete an activity, click the **I Did This!** button at the bottom of the panel, and you will be prompted for some sort of verification: answering a question, uploading a picture, etc. An administrator will then review your answer (usually within a few hours), and if your answer is approved, you will receive your points.
fields.title: Activity help

fields.contents:
The Canopy quest bar is like the regular quest bar: it shows 3 quests that you can undertake. Clicking on the title of a quest causes the quest bar to show the details of that particular quest. A second click on the title will hide the details.

Canopy quests are intended to explore the Hale Aloha real-time energy data in more depth. Each quest will ask you to examine the advanced energy visualizations and answer some questions. You can post your answers to the Canopy Feed for other Canopy members to comment on.
fields.title: Canopy Quests

fields.contents:
The quest bar shows up to 3 quests that you can undertake. Clicking on the title of a quest will show the details of that particular quest. A second click on the title will hide the details.

Quests are intended to guide you through the Kukui Cup website, highlighting interesting things and encouraging you to explore the competition. Each quest consists of a series of steps for you to undertake.

If a quest sounds interesting, click the **"I accept this quest"** button in the lower right corner of the quest description.

If you aren't interested in a quest, you can also skip it by clicking the **"I am not interested in this quest"** button.

When you have completed a quest, you will get a notification of your success, which you can share on Facebook if you choose to. Early quests are easy, while later quests are more complicated. Go forth and explore!
fields.title: Quest help

fields.contents:
This widget shows a list of upcoming events you can attend as part of the competition. Each row shows the name, number of points you can earn by attending, the time, and the place of the event. You can click on the event to find out more about it, and see who else is attending.

Below the event list, you can enter an attendance code from an event you attended. When you enter the code, you are awarded the points.
fields.title: Upcoming Events help

fields.contents:
This scoreboard rotates between 3 displays: the ranking of lounges, ranking of individuals across all towers (overall ranking), and the ranking of individuals just within your lounge. You and your lounge will be displayed in boldface in the scoreboard.

Check the scoreboard to see where you and your lounge stand in the competition.
fields.title: Points Scoreboard

fields.contents:
The **social bonus** is a way to have fun doing things with your friends and earn extra points! Certain activities and events are eligible for the social bonus. It's really easy:

1. Plan to attend an event, make a commitment, or perform an activity with one or more friends
2. Make sure you have your friend's Kukui Cup email address
3. When you click the button to get your points, you will be prompted for your friend's Kukui Cup email address
4. If the friend you entered does the same activity, you get the social bonus points
5. Your friend can enter your email address so they can also get the social bonus
fields.title: Social bonus

fields.contents:
This panel describes a commitment that you can make to earn points. If this is something you would like to commit to, click the **"I will do this"** button. Each commitment lasts a certain number of days, and you must live up to your commitment while it is active. You can have up to 5 commitments active at one time.

Once the time period is up, you can return to this page to get the rest of your points.
fields.title: Commitment help

fields.contents:
This panel describes an event that you can attend to earn points. If the event sounds interesting, you can click the **"I want to sign up"** button to indicate that you plan to attend and you will get 2 points for signing up.

At the event, there will be someone from the Kukui Cup handing out little slips of paper called *attendance codes*. When the event is over, you can come back to this page and type in the attendance code to get the rest of your points.
fields.title: Event help

fields.contents:
This panel describes an excursion that you can go on to earn points. Excursions generally involve traveling off campus, and transportation will be provided by the Kukui Cup.

If the excursion sounds interesting, you can click the **"I want to sign up"** button to indicate that you plan to attend and you will get 2 points for signing up.

On the excursion, there will be someone from the Kukui Cup handing out little slips of paper called *attendance codes*. When the excursion is over, you can come back to this page and type in the attendance code to get the rest of your points.
fields.title: Excursion help

fields.contents:
The energy scoreboard shows how your lounge is doing in the energy competition. The goal of the energy competition is to be the lounge that uses the least amount of electricity.

The scoreboard alternates between showing the amount of energy used by each lounge during the current round, and the amount of energy used overall.
fields.title: Energy scoreboard

fields.contents: This panel shows you some of the top participants in your lounge. If you click on any of the lounge members, you will be taken to a page that shows more details about each member, including their: points, ranking, badges, and commitments.
fields.title: Lounge Members

fields.contents:
The news feed is a place where you can discuss things or organize with your loungemates. Only members of your lounge can see your lounge newsfeed. To post, just type something into the text box, and press the **Post** button.

As members of your lounge do things in the competition, automatic posts will be made to the news feed so you can see what your loungemates are up to in the Cup.
fields.title: News Feed Help

fields.contents: This panel shows the most popular activities, commitments, events, and excursions in the competition. If one of them catches your eye, just click on it to see more information about it.
fields.title: Most Popular

fields.contents: This is a list of the commitments you have made. You can make up to 5 commitments at one time, and these commitments are public to other members of your lounge.
fields.title: My Public Commitments

fields.contents: This panel shows the various prizes that can be won during the competition, cycling through the different rounds of the competition. It will also show who the current leader is for each prize. For more information on a prize, click on the name of the prize.
fields.title: Prizes

fields.contents:
This panel displays the *Raffle Game*. For every 25 points you earn in the competition, you get 1 raffle ticket. Each round of the competition has a set of prizes that are awarded through the Raffle Game. You can allocate your raffle tickets to any of the prizes, as can all the other Kukui Cup players. At the end of the round, a winner is selected from the tickets allocated to that prize.

Since allocating more tickets to a prize increases your odds of winning it, you can decide whether you want to focus on one particular prize, or spread your tickets over multiple prizes. You can shift your ticket allocations as much as you want until the deadline given at the bottom of the panel. A [list of the raffle prizes in all rounds](/help/faq/list-raffle-prizes/) is available, so you can decide on your allocation strategy.

Note that raffle tickets are separate from points, you won't reduce your score by allocating raffle tickets. Good luck!
fields.title: Raffle Game

fields.contents:
This panel displays your personal profile information. Here you can change your:

* Display name (this is the name others in your lounge will see, and how you will be identified on scoreboards)
* Your picture (either upload a picture or grab from Facebook profile)
* Your preferred email address for reminders
* Your mobile number and carrier if you want to receive reminder texts for events

Remember to click the **Save Changes** link at the bottom of the panel after you make any changes.
fields.title: My Info

fields.contents: This panel displays all the badges you have acquired so far. You receive badges for certain achievements in the game. For some hints on what badges are available and how you might get them, click on the [See Badge Catalog](/profile/badges/) link.
fields.title: My Badges

fields.contents:
This panel provides 4 different visualizations of energy use in Hale Aloha:

The **Hot Spots** visualization shows hourly energy use for one lounge over a 7 day period. Large spots mean high energy use, small spots mean low energy use. The spots are red if they are among the highest 5% of energy used. This visualization lets you look for patterns of energy use in a particular lounge.

The **Heat Map** visualization shows energy use for all lounges in a particular tower over a 24 hour or 21 day period. Green squares represent lower energy use, while red squares show higher energy use. At a glance, you can see that times and what lounges seem to be using the most and least energy.

The **Line Graph** visualization shows energy or power use in one or more lounges as a line graph. You can scroll around the chart, zoom in, and see what the energy or power use was at any point in the graph.

The **Power Meter** visualization shows the current power levels on 5 lounges that you select. Note that the middle of each gauge represents the typical power for this lounge at this time of day, so the gauge needles aren't directly comparable.
fields.title: Advanced Visualizations

fields.contents: The Canopy feed is like the Lounge newsfeed on the News page, but only members of the Canopy can see and post to the Canopy feed. You can use the Canopy feed to communicate with other Canopy members and sometimes administrators might drop by.
fields.title: Canopy Feed

fields.contents: This panel shows you some of the other Canopy members. If you click on any of the lounge members, you will be taken to a page that shows more details about each member, including their: points, ranking, badges, and commitments.
fields.title: Canopy Members

fields.contents:
When you attend a Kukui Cup event or excursion, make sure you get an attendance code from one of the Kukui Cup staff members at the event. The code will come on a little slip of paper, make sure you save it! When the event is finished, you can type the code into the field here and click **Submit**, and then you will get the points you earned by attending the event.

Note that each attendance code is only good for the event it was issued at, and can only be used once, like a ticket to a concert. So don't share your attendance code with friends, make sure they get their own!
fields.title: Attendance Code Entry

fields.contents:
Canopy Missions are similar to the quests you are familiar with from the "forest" part of the Kukui Cup. They guide you through things to do in the Canopy. There are two types of missions:

 * **Solo** missions can be completed by yourself. Just click on the mission title, and a brief description will be displayed. Linked from the mission are one or more Canopy activities that you must finish to complete the mission.

* **Group** missions require you to team up with 1 or 2 other Canopy members. You must sign up for group missions by clicking the **I am up for this mission** button, which then shows you are interested in the mission. Get together with other Canopy members who are interested in the mission and look at the associated activity. When your group has completed the activity, one member from your team will submit the results of the activity, and list the other members of the team in the submission dialog box. Once approved, all team members will get the Karma.
fields.title: Canopy Missions

fields.contents: The Canopy Karma scoreboard shows you the amount of Karma earned by each member of the Canopy. Canopy Karma is separate from normal Kukui Cup points, and does not earn you raffle tickets. Mostly, it's for bragging rights, though there is a prize for the person with the most Canopy Karma at the end of the competition.
fields.title: Canopy Scoreboard

fields.contents: The Kukui Cup residence hall energy competition is a blend of real world and online activities. In the real world, participants attend events, engage in real-world activities like parties, scavenger hunts, and artistic/musical events, win prizes, and most importantly, modify their energy-related behaviors. In the online world of the Kukui Cup web application, participants earn points, achieve badges, increase their energy literacy through readings and videos, and use social networking mechanisms to engage with friends about the event. Our hope is that this combination of real and virtual activities complement and reinforce each other.
fields.title: What is the Kukui Cup?

fields.contents: The daily water goal game is designed to reward you for conserving water.  Each day, a Kukui Cup administrator will read your team's water meter and record the results.  If you can conserve water beyond a baseline value calculated for your team, then every participating team member will receive points!
fields.title: Water Goal Game

fields.contents:
The water scoreboard shows how your lounge is doing in the water competition. The goal of the water competition is to be the lounge that uses the least amount of water.

The scoreboard alternates between showing the amount of water used by each team during the current round, and the amount of water used overall.
fields.title: Water Scoreboard

fields.name: Get social
fields.description:
To be successful, the Kukui Cup needs a lot of people to participate and we need your help. This quest is about getting the word out about the Kukui Cup to your social network.

To complete this quest, you will have to complete one activity: Like Kukui Cup on Facebook.

Find this activity in the Smart Grid Game and complete it to finish off this quest.

fields.name: Learn Secrets of Kukui Cup Masters
fields.description:
Do you want some hints about how to win the Kukui Cup? We've prepared a special video for you, called *Secrets of the Kukui Cup Masters*. Watch it to learn strategies for playing the Kukui Cup.

**To complete this quest:**

1. If you aren't already on the Get Nutz page, click on the Get Nutz icon in the navigation bar at the top of every page
2. Click on the second square in the first column of the Smart Grid Game
3. Watch the video
4. Answer a question about it correctly
5. Put your newly learned strategies to work

fields.name: Watch Intro Video
fields.description:
Every quest starts with a single step, and yours should start by watching the Kukui Cup introduction video that you seem to have skipped when you logged in for the first time. The video will help you to understand what the Kukui Cup is all about, and briefly introduce you to the things you can do to win.

To watch the video:

1. Click on the Get Nutz icon in the navigation bar at the top left of this web page
2. Click on the first square in the first level of the Smart Grid Game (upper left corner of grid)
3. Watch the video
4. Answer a question about it correctly
5. You are on your way to Kukui Cup domination!

fields.name: Sign up for an event
fields.description:
Part of the Kukui Cup is a series of events scheduled throughout the competition. These events are designed to be fun and help you learn about energy and sustainability. You can sign up for an event to indicate your interest in attending, and see who else is going.

Signing up for an event gets you 2 points. At the event, you will receive a little slip of paper that contains an attendance code. This code is like a ticket stub, it proves that you attended the event. Once the event is over, you can enter the attendance code to get the rest of your points (usually 20 points or more).

**To complete this quest:**

1. Go to the Get Nutz page
2. Either pick an event from the **Upcoming Events** section, or click on an event square in the grid
3. Read the about the event
4. If you want to attend, click the "I want to sign up" button
5. Attend the event when it happens.
6. Don't forget to come back after the event with your attendance code to get the rest of your points.

fields.name: Make a commitment
fields.description:
One of the things you can do in the Kukui Cup is make a commitment. Commitments range from little things, like turning off the lights, to big things, like not eating meat. Each commitment lasts for 5 days, during which you agree to live up to the commitment. Once the 5 days are over, you come back to the site to collect your points.

Making a commitment earns you 2 points, and when you come back 5 days later to certify that you lived up to your commitment, you get another 5 points. To keep you focused, you can only commit to 5 things at a time.

**To complete this quest:**

1. If you aren't already on the Get Nutz page, click on the Get Nutz icon in the navigation bar at the top of every page
2. Click on a commitment square (the legend shows which color squares are commitments).
3. Read about the commitment you are being asked to make.
4. If you are willing, click the **"I will do this!"** button
5. Don't forget to come back in 5 days to get the rest of your points

fields.unlock_conditions: completed_action('intro-video') and has_points(25) and not allocated_ticket()
fields.name: Participate in the Raffle
fields.description:
An exciting side game in the Kukui Cup is the Raffle Game, which you can find on the Prizes page. Click on the Prizes icon in the navigation bar to get to the Prizes page. The Raffle Game is on the right hand side of the Prizes page.

For every 25 points you earn, you get a raffle ticket. You can allocate your ticket(s) to any of the prizes in the raffle, and each ticket gives you one chance to win the prize at the end of the round. However, all the other players are also allocating their raffle tickets to the prizes, which lowers your odds. You can change your allocation of tickets at any time until the Raffle Game deadline shown below the list of prizes. At the end of the round, the Raffle Game randomly picks one ticket for each prize, and the owner of that ticket wins the prize!

**Step by step:**

1. Go to the **Prizes** page
2. Pick one of the raffle prizes
3. Allocate one ticket to it using the **+1** button.

fields.name: Check lounge energy use
fields.description:
While making commitments and completing activities is important, the other side of the Kukui Cup is reducing your lounge's energy usage.

The **Go Low** page can show you how much power & energy your lounge is using in real time.

To complete this quest, perform the "Examine your lounge's energy use" activity on the Get Nutz page. You'll find it under the **Let's Get Physical** category, on level 2 of the Smart Grid Game. You can switch between the levels by clicking on the tabs above the grid.

fields.name: Get the Super Committed badge
fields.description:
While earning points and conserving energy is great, wouldn't it be awesome if there was a way to get a little recognition for all your hard work? Lucky for you, there is: **BADGES**. Badges represent achievements reached during the game, both big and small.

For the most part, you'll have to discover the badges on your own, but we're going to give you a hint on this one. You will receive the Super Committed badge when you make 5 commitments (the maximum allowed by law). To complete this quest, you just need to get the badge by topping off your commitments to 5.

You know the drill by now: go to the Get Nutz page, click on a commitment square in the Smart Grid Game, and get your badge. *Note:* you may have to complete some other activities or look on different levels to get unlock all 5 commitments.

fields.name: Learn about energy
fields.description:
The Kukui Cup is all about energy: learning about it and conserving it. On this quest, you will learn some basic information about power and energy, which will give you a solid foundation for all the other energy-related activities in the game.

**To complete this quest:** You must watch two videos (**Power & Energy**, and **Energy Intuition**) and answer a question about each.

You can find the videos in the Smart Grid Game, which is located on the Get Nutz page. To get there:

1. If you aren't already on the Get Nutz page, click on the Get Nutz icon in the navigation bar at the top of every page
2. Click on the third square in the **Get Started** column of the grid
3. Watch the video (pay attention, as you will answer a question about it next)
4. Click the **"I Did This!"** button
5. Answer a question about the content of the video. If you don't know the answer, click Cancel and watch the video again.
6. Click the **"Back to Smart Grid Game"** button on left side.
7. The second video is the bottom square of the same column of the Smart Grid Game
8. A Kukui Cup Admin will review your answer (usually in a few hours) and if you answered correctly, you will be awarded 10 points for each video.

fields.name: Find your theme
fields.description:
You may not have realized it, but it is possible to select a different "skin" for your personal Kukui Cup interface. The goal of this quest is for you to explore the different user interface themes and decide which one works best for you. To do it:

1. Go to the Profile Page.
2. In the "My Info" window, find the "Theme" pull-down menu. Select one of the other themes.
3. Press "Save Changes" to enable your new theme.

Enjoy your personalized Kukui Cup experience!

fields.name: Check your lounge's participation
fields.description:
You're playing the Kukui Cup hard, but how is the rest of your lounge doing? Are they playing the Cup? To win the lounge prizes, you need your dormies to start playing the game and reducing their energy use!

In the Smart Grid Game there is an activity to examine your lounge's participation rate in the **Just Do It** category. Find the activity and complete it to complete this quest.

fields.about_page_text:
Follow @kukuicup

##What is the Kukui Cup?## The Kukui Cup is an advanced energy challenge that combines real-time energy feedback, energy education, multiple forms of incentives, and gamification techniques to support positive changes in energy behavior. The inaugural Kukui Cup was held in Fall, 2011 for over 1,000 first year students living in the Hale Aloha residence halls at the University of Hawaii. We are planning the second Kukui Cup for Fall, 2012. ##Why is the Kukui Cup important to Hawaii?## One of the great challenges facing Hawaii today is our dependence on foreign oil, which negatively affects our security, our economy, our environment, and our next generation's ability to have a healthy, prosperous, sustainable lifestyle. The Kukui Cup raises awareness about Hawaii's oil dependency and how to work toward a better energy future. We created the following three minute video to help explain why we believe energy issues are so important to Hawaii.
##How it works## Students participating in the Kukui Cup challenge can login to the website during the challenge to gain access about their current power consumption and cumulative energy use. The site also provides short videos developed specifically for the competition that provide insight into Hawaii energy issues, and students can earn points by correctly answering questions about each video's content. Other ways to earn points include meeting a daily energy conservation goal, attending short, interactive "workshops" about energy, or going on excursions to power plants, wind farms, and more. Participation can lead to prizes including t-shirts, pizza parties, and gift certificates. By playing the game, students become knowledgeable about the energy challenges facing Hawaii and how to change their own behavior and those around them to use energy more efficiently. The following two minute video was used in 2011 to introduce students to the Kukui Cup; it is one of the first things they watched after logging in to the website:
##For more information## For more information, please go to kukuicup.org.

Books, notebooks, magazines, art supplies, computers... you name it, Amazon's got it. With this gift certificate you'll be able to pick something up that you need (or maybe just want!).

This $20 gift certificate goes to the individual with the highest point total at the end of the Beta Test.

This gift certificate will score you one free ice cream cone from Bubbie's Ice Cream, just a short walk from the residence halls and one of the best ice cream parlors in Hawaii. 

To win this $5 gift certificate, your team must earn more points than any other team during the Beta Test.

fields.description: What do beer cans, car tires and water bottles have in common? Not much unless you're renegade architect Michael Reynolds, in which case they are tools of choice for producing thermal mass and energy-independent housing. For 30 years New Mexico-based Reynolds and his green disciples have devoted their time to advancing the art of "Earthship Biotecture" by building self-sufficient, off-the-grid communities where design and function converge in eco-harmony. However, these experimental structures that defy state standards create conflict between Reynolds and the authorities, who are backed by big business. Frustrated by antiquated legislation, Reynolds lobbies for the right to create a sustainable living test site. While politicians hum and ha, Mother Nature strikes, leaving communities devastated by tsunamis and hurricanes. Reynolds and his crew seize the opportunity to lend their pioneering skills to those who need it most. Shot over three years and in four countries, Garbage Warrior is a timely portrait of a determined visionary, a hero of the 21st century.
fields.title: Garbage Warrior

fields.name: Like Cup

fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Secrets of the Kukui Cup video activity
fields.description: Show support for the Kukui Cup by Liking the Kukui Cup page on Facebook (it will open in a new window). Follow the link, click on the "Like" button, and then back on this page click the **I Did This!** button. You will be prompted for your name on Facebook so we can verify your Like. For you eager beavers that have already liked the Kukui Cup before the competition started, you can get points too. Just click **I Did This!** and tell us your Facebook name.

fields.name: Tweet link
fields.title: Tweet about Kukui Cup
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Secrets of the Kukui Cup video activity
fields.description:
If you use Twitter, tweet a link to the Kukui Cup website by pressing this button (will open in a new window) so other folks will learn about the competition:
Tweet Kukui Cup
Once you have tweeted, come back to this page and click the "I Did This!" button. You will be prompted for your Twitter username so we can confirm your tweet.

fields.name: Door Art
fields.title: Door Art Challenge
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Secrets of the Kukui Cup video activity
fields.description: Show your support for the Kukui Cup by decorating your door in an "energy conscious" fashion. You can do any of the following: include Kukui Cup logos or screen shots, invent new tag lines, show pictures related to energy, or anything else that communicates energy consciousness. When completed, take a photo of your door and click the **I Did This** button to submit the picture. Based on the awesomeness of your design, you will get between 5-15 points!

fields.name: Turn off lights
fields.title: I will turn off the lights when leaving any room
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Power & Energy or Cup Secrets video activity
fields.description: Leaving lights on wastes energy for no purpose. Commit to turning off the lights when leaving any room.

fields.name: Task lighting
fields.title: I will use task lighting instead of overhead lights
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Power & Energy or Cup Secrets video activity
fields.description: Commit to using task lighting (like a desk lamp) instead of overhead room lights when possible. Often overhead lights provide more light than you need, or might not provide the light where you need it. Using a desk lamp will reduce your electricity use while giving you the light you need, where you need it.

fields.name: Use sunlight
fields.title: I will use sunlight instead of electric lighting
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Power & Energy or Cup Secrets video activity
fields.description: Commit to using sunlight from windows or outdoors instead of turning on electric lighting. This can mean opening shades instead of turning on the lights, and/or planning your day so that tasks that require light (like reading books) are done during the day.

fields.name: Full load laundry
fields.title: I will wash only full loads of laundry
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Intro Video
fields.description: Commit to always washing full loads of laundry. Washing less than a full load is less efficient, leading to more electricity and water being used per piece of laundry washed.

fields.name: Reusable bag
fields.title: I will bring reusable bags when shopping
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Power & Energy or Cup Secrets video activity
fields.description: Commit to bringing and using reusable bags when shopping instead of the paper or plastic ones offered by stores. Making disposable bags requires energy, and often the bags end up in our landfills or worse yet they blow away into the ocean. Using a reusable bag saves energy and keeps trash out of our landfills.

fields.name: Virtual Event
fields.title: Attend a virtual event!
fields.description:
In a real Kukui Cup challenge, players are able to attend a variety of events (workshops and excursions) in which they can learn more about energy and sustainability issues.  

For demonstration purposes, this "virtual event" simply shows you how events work.  You can click the button to sign up for the event and you'll immediately receive points.  Later, we'll send you an attendance code for the event via email.  (Normally, these are distributed on slips of paper at the actual event, which verifies that players actually attended.) You can enter that attendance code into the system to receive full credit for the event.

fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
<!---
<center>![Go Low icon](/site_media/staticimages/icons/icon-go-low-lg.png)</center>
--->

One important aspect of the Kukui Cup is the Daily Energy Goal Game, which can be found on the [Go Low](/energy) page. Every lounge is assigned a daily energy goal that represents a 5% reduction in electricity use from what the lounge was using before the competition. The Energy Goal Game shows how much energy your lounge has used so far today, and how that compares to the energy goal. The game also shows some activities that might be helpful in getting your lounge to reduce its energy use.

For this activity, you will check out the [Go Low](/energy) page. Read the page over, and come back to here and report three things: is your lounge above or below the energy goal, by how much, and name one activity that might help your lounge conserve energy.

fields.name: Computer Sleep
fields.title: Configure your computer to sleep after inactivity
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
Configure your computer and any external monitor to sleep after 20 minutes of inactivity (or less). You can find instructions on enabling sleep functionality at the [EnergySTAR website](http://www.energystar.gov/index.cfm?c=power_mgt.pr_power_mgt_users).

Once you have changed your settings, please take a screenshot showing the new settings for use in verification:

  * [How to take a screenshot on Windows](http://www.wikihow.com/Take-a-Screenshot-in-Microsoft-Windows)
  * [How to take a screenshot on Mac OS X](/help/faq/how-screenshot-mac/)

fields.name: Filler-2
fields.title: Filler 2
fields.unlock_condition_text: This cell is here only to fill out the grid. There is no action associated with it.

fields.name: Power Hogs
fields.title: Label power hogs in your room
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
<!---
This is a followup activity to the [energy audit](/activities/activity/audit-room/) activity. If you haven't performed that activity, do it first and keep your notes around for this activity.
--->

Make a label for each device in your room that shows the number of watts consumed when on and off, and put it close to the power switch for those devices that have them. You'll need a portable energy meter such as a Belkin Conserve Insight to do this.

Once you have made the labels, take a photo of the labels of as many devices as you can fit in one picture to be used for verification.

fields.description: Commit to turning off your computer/TV/game console and doing something that doesn't require electricity instead every day. There are many things you can do both on and off campus that don't require electricity, go find them!

fields.name: Limit TV
fields.title: I will limit my TV use to 1 hour a day
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Go Unplugged
fields.description: Commit to using your TV (watching shows, movies, playing games) for less than 1 hour per day. Widescreen TVs use a lot of electricity, so putting a limit on how much you use them will reduce your electricity use.

fields.name: Go meatless
fields.title: I will not eat meat
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Limit TV
fields.description: Commit to not eating any meat (beef, pork, chicken, fish, shellfish, etc) during the commitment period. Producing meat (beef in particular) uses a great deal of energy, and produces a great deal of greenhouse gasses. A vegetarian diet uses less energy and emits less greenhouse gas. There are many of vegetarian food options both on campus and around Honolulu, try them out!

fields.name: Letter to Editor
fields.title: Write a letter to the editor on a Kukui Cup topic
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
This activity is an opportunity to creatively explore one of the topics of the Kukui Cup in more depth. For this activity, you will write a **letter to the editor** of a local publication on the subject of one of the categories from the Smart Grid such as energy, lighting, transportation, etc. Note that this activity will require significantly more effort than normal activities, but it is also worth more points. This activity is worth a variable number of points, so the more effort and the higher quality of your letter, the more points you will receive.

Some local publications you might write to:

* [Honolulu Weekly](http://honoluluweekly.com/contact-us/)
* [Star-Advertiser](http://www.staradvertiser.com/info/Star-Advertiser_Letter_to_the_Editor.html)
* [MidWeek](http://www.midweek.com/content/columns/lte_article/letters_to_the_editor1031/) (scroll to bottom for submission info)

fields.description: While traditional ideas of a date include significant consumption, here's your chance to do something radical:  have a good time with a friend while using the minimum amount of electrical energy possible! Use this as an opportunity to be creative: how many different things can you do with a friend while using the least possible energy? Consider your transportation: can you walk, ride a bike, or take public transportation? Consider your food: what can you eat together that is delicious but was grown, delivered, and prepared with minimal energy? Consider your entertainment: what can you do together that is interesting, novel, and fun that does not consume resources?

fields.name: Shower flow
fields.title: Measure shower water flow
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
Figure out how much water is used by the showers in your floor's bathroom. To do this, you will need a large container with a known volume (like a water bottle or bucket) that you can fill in the shower, and a clock of some type (like your watch or cell phone). Make sure to not get your clock wet if it isn't waterproof!

Hold the container up to the shower head, turn on the shower faucet to the level you use normally when showering, and note the time on the clock (or use a stopwatch). Watch the container fill, and note the time when it is completely full of water.

Now you know the volume of water that the shower put out, and the amount of time it was running. From these two values, you can compute the flow rate of your shower by dividing the volume by the number of seconds it took to fill. For example, if you filled a 1 gallon bucket and it took 30 seconds, then the flow rate is 2 gallons per minute.

As you will see, water comes out of shower heads pretty fast, which is why it is important to turn off the water when you aren't actively using it, like while soaping up.

fields.name: Window Art
fields.title: Create Energy Window Art
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity, and wait for Round 2
fields.description:
Every night, the Hale Aloha residence halls create a mosaic of lit windows as students quietly study in their rooms. At least, that's what we hope you're doing in there.

It occurs to us that this mosaic of lit windows provides an opportunity for you to both be creative and inform fellow students coming back from the library about the Kukui Cup and/or energy conservation.

So, for this activity, create art on your room window that is visible from outside at night. The art should have some relationship to the theme of the Kukui Cup: use your imagination. To receive credit for this activity, take a picture of it (preferably at night) and include some text describing what your art is about. The more amazing, creative, and energy-related your window art, the more points you can earn. Since you still want to save energy, we recommend that you light up your art between 9-9:15 PM, you don't need to keep it lit all night long.

Another way to get more points for this activity is to enlist your neighbors beside you, above you, or below you to create a coordinated group window art effort. Take a photo of all of the windows, then tell us in the description which one is yours.

The more awesome your art, the closer to 50 points you'll earn.

fields.name: Room Energy
fields.title: Estimate your room's total daily energy consumption
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete room energy audit activity
fields.description:
Ever wonder how much energy your room consumes in a day? Here's a simple procedure to figure it out.

1. Check out a Belkin Conserve Insight meter from your tower's front desk (CDC)
2. Find out how much energy your appliances use on average. For refrigerators, monitor their energy consumption for 30 minutes, then multiply by 48 to get an estimate of its total consumption for 24 hours. For microwaves, monitor its energy consumption during a 1 minute period, then multiply by the number of minutes per day that you and your roommate typically use it. Do the same for your other appliances: computer, Xbox, fans, etc.
3. To receive credit for this activity, submit a list of the appliances in your room, your estimate of the energy each of them consume per day, and the total amount of energy your entire room uses per day (in watt-hours or kilowatt-hours). Remember to include an estimate for the overhead light if you use it. Are you surprised by this data?

fields.name: Find Waste
fields.title: Seek out campus energy waste
fields.description:
By now you're an expert in finding energy waste in your lounge. For this activity, you will roam around campus, looking for places where you think energy is being wasted on campus. Energy waste can happen in many ways, here are a few ideas to get you started:

* Lights not getting turned off at night (try looking around campus after dark)
* Air conditioners running when doors or windows are open
* Air conditioning systems that make buildings too cold
* Computers left on in a lab even when nobody is using them

Report to us your list of energy waste going on around campus, and how each one might be fixed. For every distinct wasting situation you find, we'll award 5 Canopy Karma points, up to 50 points. We'll also pass your list on the the appropriate people to try to get the wasting stopped!

fields.name: Geo Trek
fields.title: Energy Geo Trek across campus
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
Want to go on a "geo trek"? Have a smart phone that can display Google Maps (or a friend who has one and wants to play with you)? Have an hour to walk around campus and learn about UH energy and sustainability projects? Then you're all set!

Here's the deal: you'll use your smartphone (and your own smarts) to follow a trail of clues around campus and discover eight different locations related to energy or sustainability. Each location is tagged with a special Kukui Cup sign so you'll know when you've found it. Once there, take a picture of yourself with the sign in the background for verification, and upload to [Flickr](http://www.flickr.com/). You will earn 5 Kukui Cup points for each location you find.  The sign also contains a URL that you can retrieve to obtain directions to the next location.

Ready?  Here's the first clue (you'll want to open it on your smartphone): [http://goo.gl/psXER](http://goo.gl/psXER)

When you are done, come back here, click **I Did This!** and provide us with a link to your Flickr account so we can verify your trek.

fields.name: Interview
fields.title: Interview someone about a Kukui Cup topic
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity, and wait for Round 2
fields.description:
This activity is an opportunity to creatively explore one of the topics of the Kukui Cup in more depth. For this activity, you will **interview** an expert on one of the subjects used as categories in the Smart Grid such as energy, lighting, or transportation. Note that this activity will require significantly more effort than normal activities, but it is also worth more points. This activity is worth a variable number of points, so the more effort and the higher quality of your interview, the more points you will receive.

Some possible interview subjects:

* School administrators (Facilities Management, Sustainability Corps)
* School faculty
* Local environmental organizations (Blue Planet Foundation, Kanu Hawaii, Surfrider Foundation)
* Local politicians (City Council, State Legislature, Congressional delegation)
* Local industry (First Wind, solar installation companies)
* Local government (DBEDT energy office, PUC)

You will have to find someone to interview, figure out what questions you want to ask them in advance, and then go interview them. You will probably want to record your interview so that you can refer to it later, but make sure you ask your subject if recording them is OK!

Your resulting interview can be written (like you might see in a magazine), and audio recording, or even a video. Note that making a quality audio and video interview is quite challenging, so make sure you know what you are getting into.

fields.name: Photo Chain
fields.title: Play the photo chain game
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Secrets of the Kukui Cup video activity
fields.description:
**Note, this picture is an example, you must check Flickr to see what the last picture in the chain is**
</center>

Show off the Kukui Cup and your creativity at the same time by playing the Kukui Cup Photo Chain Game. The rules are simple. You are going to add a photo of yourself to the end of the chain of photos in the [Flickr Kukui Cup 2011 Photo Chain Game group](http://www.flickr.com/groups/kukuicup-2011-photo-chain-game/).  Each photo contains:

1. yourself in some kind of "pose"
2. you holding or wearing some Kukui Cup item (t-shirt, water bottle, eco-tote, or tumbler)

To make the sequence of photos a chain, your photo must "match" the preceding photo posted to the group with respect to either the pose, the location, or the Kukui Cup item.

The caption to each photo should list the pose, the location, and the item.

Here's how you do it:

1. Go to the [Flickr Kukui Cup 2011 Photo Chain Game group](http://www.flickr.com/groups/kukuicup-2011-photo-chain-game/). See what photo is at the end of the list.
2. Take a photo of yourself in a way that extends the chain (match either the pose, location, or item)
3. Upload your photo to your own Flickr account (creating it if necessary).
4. Go back to the [Flickr Kukui Cup 2011 Photo Chain Game group](http://www.flickr.com/groups/kukuicup-2011-photo-chain-game/), and "join" the group. 
5. Click "Add Photos" and select your photo. 
6. Provide a title, such as "Photo Chain Game 12" (or whatever the next number is in the chain).
7. Provide a caption that indicates: pose, location, item, and which of the three matches.
8. Save.
9. Click **I Did This!** button and tell us your Flickr name so we can confirm your upload to the group and award your points.

fields.name: Make Video
fields.title: Make a video on a Kukui Cup topic
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Energy Intuition video activity
fields.description:
This activity is an opportunity to creatively explore one of the topics of the Kukui Cup in more depth. For this activity, you will make a **video** on the subject of one of the categories from the Smart Grid such as energy, lighting, transportation and post it on YouTube. Note that this activity will require significantly more effort than normal activities, but it is also worth more points. This activity is worth a variable number of points, so the more effort and the higher quality of your video, the more points you will receive.

Making a interesting video can be hard work. You'll find it much easier if you write out a little "screenplay" beforehand and think about what you want to communicate. YouTube has a [Handbook](http://www.youtube.com/t/yt_handbook_produce) with lots of great tips on making videos. Points will be awarded based on your video's originality, quality, and impact. For example, you talking into your webcam will get fewer points than visualizing your points with images or outdoor video. Make sure you mention the Kukui Cup either in your video or in the description field. When your video is ready, you can submit the URL for verification and scoring.

*When submitting a video created by a group of players, please let us know how many people are planning to submit the video for points so we can divide the credit.*

fields.name: Refer friend
fields.title: Refer a friend to the Kukui Cup
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Intro video activity, and wait for Round 2
fields.description:
Starting in Round 2, the Kukui Cup provides a new feature: referral bonuses. Each time you get a new user to sign up for the Kukui Cup, you can earn 10 points. All you need to do is have the new user enter your email address on the new "Referral Bonus" page during their initial login.   Both you and they will earn 10 extra points as soon as the new user earns 30 points with regular game play. There is **NO LIMIT** to the number of times you can earn a referral bonus, so start signing up your friends now!

To help you get started, you can earn five extra points for one of your referrals by completing this activity. Just type in the email address of the new user you brought to the Kukui Cup in the box below. You will get your five points after the new user gets to 30 points.

Note that while this activity is just a one-shot deal, the referral bonus feature that it introduces you to can be done repeatedly.  You do not have to wait for your first referral to complete before getting new referrals.   Nor do you have to even do this activity at all in order to get referral bonuses.  So, go out there, get as many new players to sign up and enter your email as possible, and you will get 10 points each time they achieve 30 points.  (You can even coach them through their first 30 points to make sure they get a proper introduction to the game).

fields.name: Share link

fields.description: If you have an account on Google's new social network Google+, share the Kukui Cup website there to get the word out about the competition. Go to Google+ (will open in a new window) and click on the small paperclip icon to share a link: Enter the text "http://kukuicup.manoa.hawaii.edu/" next to the paperclip icon and press the **Add** button. If you do not share the link publicly, we will not be able to verify it. Then press the **Share** button. Once you have updated your status, go to your Google+ profile and copy the URL which will look something like "https://plus.google.com/" followed by a long number. Then come back to this page and click the "I Did This!" button. Paste in that profile URL so we can see your snazzy public post.

fields.title: Learn more about the Hawaii Clean Energy Initiative
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete HCEI video activity

fields.name: Good Samaritan
fields.title: Help a lounge doing poorly in energy competition
fields.description:
The Kukui Cup is a competition, but the energy problems that Hawaii and the planet face will potentially affect everyone and everything. For this group activity, you will pick one of the lounges doing the worst in the energy competition, and go help them to conserve more.

If you have friends in the lounge, that might be a good place to start. You can also approach the RAs for the lounge to find out what steps they have taken so far.

When you are done, click the button below and tell us what you did, and how much energy you think you are helping them to save. Depending on what you've done, you'll earn between 15 to 50 Canopy Karma.

fields.name: Solar Energy 2
fields.title: Learn more about solar energy
fields.unlock_condition_text: Complete Solar Energy video activity

fields.name: Compare Homes
fields.title: Energy comparison between group member's homes
fields.description:
Now that you know more about your energy use while you live in Hale Aloha, we want you to think about your family's energy use at home. Each member of your group should ask their own family for a copy of their latest energy bill (or the information from it), or even the last few bills if they have them.

As a group, sit down and compare the energy use between your families and think about the following questions:

* How much energy does each family use on average?
* How does the energy usage between families compare when you take into account the number of people living in the home?
* The members of your groups probably live in different places, how do you think their locations affect the amount of energy they use? Mainland US vs. Hawaii or even International?
* For each family, what do you think the 3 biggest consumers of energy are?

Once you are done, submit the results of your comparison below. What have you learned?

fields.name: Attend Outside Event
fields.title: Attend some event related to energy/sustainability
fields.description:
As part of the Kukui Cup, we've tried to introduce you to other groups in the community that are interested in energy and sustainability. For this activity, you will find an event hosted by one of those groups, attend and tell us how it went. Here's a list of possible groups to check for events, but feel free to go beyond it:

* [Student Organic Farm Training](http://www.ctahr.hawaii.edu/sustainag/soft/)
* [Sustainable UH](http://sustainable.hawaii.edu/)
* [Kanu Hawaii](http://www.kanuhawaii.org/)
* [Sierra Club](http://www.sierraclubhawaii.com/)
* [Cycle Manoa](http://cyclemanoa.org/)
* Or check out [Honolulu Weekly's Green page](http://honoluluweekly.com/your-inbox/green.html)

Take a picture of the meeting or event, and come back here to submit the picture and tell us what happened and what you learned.

fields.name: Heat Map
fields.title: The Heat is On
fields.description:
Check out the Heat Map visualization below, which shows hourly or daily energy use for all lounges in a tower. Come up with answers to the questions below, and submit them:

1. What patterns do you see in the data?
2. Do you notice any spatial patterns?
3. What are your thoughts on this visualization? What are its strengths and weaknesses?
